hypothesis_content.title: BTC Extreme RSI Reversal After News-Driven Spikes
hypothesis_content.statement: When BTC experiences a sharp price spike (+8% in 24h) driven by positive news headlines (e.g., treasury buying, ETF inflows), followed by RSI(14) exceeding 85 on the 4H chart, a mean reversion short entry will be profitable within the next 3-5 days as retail FOMO exhausts.
hypothesis_content.rationale: News-driven spikes in neutral/bull regimes often attract late retail buyers, creating temporary overbought conditions. Institutional flows typically fade into strength, and mean reversion tends to occur when technical extremes align with sentiment peaks.
entry_conditions: Price at least 2 standard deviations above 20-day Bollinger Band midline

exit_conditions.take_profit: Price retraces to 20-day SMA OR RSI(14) crosses below 50 on 4H chart
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price makes new 4H high above entry candle

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: If >60% of such setups continue trending upward for >7 days without meaningful retracement (defined as <50% retracement of the initial spike).
